sentences.sContent: He’s merely a boy – you can’t expect him to understand.
sentences.sCn: 他只是个孩子——你不要指望他能理解。

sentences.sContent: ...compare those excellent letters with a merely good letter: the candidate was productive...
...The traditional textbook merely serves as a skeleton...
...friends and acquaintances in real life instead of merely through the Internet...
...Are employers merely paying lip service to the DDA...
...as if merely recognizing it could put us on a path to a solution...

trans.tranOther: used to emphasize how small or unimportant something or someone is
